contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=January 2011}} '''Gregory "Greg" Hollingshead''', CM (born 25 Feb 1947 in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]]) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[novelist]].<ref> [http://books.google.ca/books?id=Mkh2vJ_9GpEC&pg=PA507&lpg=PA507&dq=Greg+Hollingshead+25+feb+1947&source=bl&ots=beecYVAZvY&sig=2yrOXmNjFHzYTXE-uolgP_ylTwU&hl=en&ei=s_FcS8enIMLd8QaAsvXyBA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CBAQ6AEwAzgK#v=onepage&q=Greg%20Hollingshead%2025%20feb%201947&f=false Greg Hollingshead entry in the book Encyclopedia of Literature in Canada]</ref> He is currently a professor of [[English language|English]] at the [[University of Alberta]]. He lives in [[Edmonton]], [[Alberta]]. He is a graduate of the [[University of Toronto Schools]]<ref>[http://robmclennan.blogspot.com/2008/01/12-or-20-questions-with-greg.html</ref> and the [[University of Toronto]]. ==Works== *''Famous Players'' - 1982 *''White Buick'' - 1992 *''Spin Dry'' - 1992 *''The Roaring Girl'' - 1995 (short fiction, winner of the [[1995 Governor General's Awards|1995 Governor General's Award for Fiction]]) *''The Healer'' - 1998 *''Bedlam'' - 2004 ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=114951244}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Hollingshead, Greg | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1947 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hollingshead, Greg}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Canadian novelists]] [[Category:Canadian short story writers]] [[Category:University of Toronto alumni]] [[Category:University of Alberta faculty]] [[Category:Governor General's Award winning fiction writers]] [[Category:Members of the Order of Canada]]
